sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The compleat memoirs of the life of that notorious impostor Will. Morrell, alias Bowyer, alias Wickham, &c. Who died at Mr. Cullen's the bakers in the strand, Jan. 3. 1691/2. With considerable additions never before published. Licensed, April 14. 1694. Settle, Elkanah, 1648-1724.
[8], 88 p.
printed for Abel Roper and E. Wilkinson at the Black Boy over against St. Dunstan's Church in Fleet-street, London : 1694.
Dedication signed: E. Settle. Running title reads: The history of the life of William Morrell alias Bowyer. Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
=======
The compleat memoirs of the life of that notorious impostor Will. Morrell, alias Bowyer, alias Wickham, &c. Who died at Mr. Cullen's the bakers in the strand, Jan. 3. 1691/2. With considerable additions never before published. Licensed, April 14. 1694. Settle, Elkanah, 1648-1724.
[8], 88 p.
printed for Abel Roper and E. Wilkinson at the Black Boy over against St. Dunstan's Church in Fleet-street, London : 1694.
Dedication signed: E. Settle. Running title reads: The history of the life of William Morrell alias Bowyer. Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
Abel Roper
E. Wilkinson
the Black Boy over against St. Dunstan's Church in Fleet-street
